noun.description: A substance that flows freely but is of constant volume, having a consistency like that of water or oil.
A consonant produced by allowing the airstream to flow over the sides of the tongue, and able to be prolonged like a vowel (typically l and r).

adjective.description: Having a consistency like that of water or oil, i.e., flowing freely but of constant volume.
(of a sound) clear, pure, and flowing; harmonious.
examples: the liquid song of the birds

adjective.description: (of assets) held in cash or easily converted into cash.
(of a consonant, typically l and r) produced by allowing the airstream to flow over the sides of the tongue, and able to be prolonged like a vowel.

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin liquidus, from liquere be liquid.
